review_list:
We tried out Mom's because we were staying right around the corner. It didn't disappoint and make sure to take up their 2 for 1 offer for 18" Cheese Pizzas. It started at noon and lasted through dinner time. Great affordable option and tasted yummy!

We were in crazy expensive South Beach for the week after Christmas. This pizza place was right around the corner and I am glad we gave it try. We ordered slices one day and enjoyed them so much (the slices are huge!) that we ordered again during the week. Great customer service and great pizza!

This is a very basic fast-food pizza place but with superb product. I bought a slice today and I was hooked. Will keep coming back until I get sick of pizza or time to go home, whichever comes first. I think going home will come first.

We arrived round the corner but used the restaurants on ocean drive of which none were that great and all were over priced. Then we found this place and it made our night. Great pizza very tasty. Great price and interesting service brilliant in every way

Very flavorful food and a convient location in walking distance of the beach. We ordered the buffalo wings and the garlic knots. Prices were what we expected.

Best pizza ever ! Small pizza boutique but big Italian Spirit . You have to take a slice And eat it in front of The Beach . Thank you Mom's pizza !

Located across from the Dream Hotel is a busy pizza joint that never seemed to close. One late night after hanging out we decided to try Mom's and it was soooooo good!! Now I see why there are crowds coming & going!

Every time I visit SoBe, I have to stop here. Huge slices of pizza for $4-$6, depending on toppings. The owner is a cool guy, also. They have late hours, which is great for grabbing a bite after partying.

We loved the pizza here! Very fresh and flavorful. And you can't beat the price - great deal especially for south beach. The staff was also super friendly.

Just had some 7pm grumblies after a late lunch, filled by a slice of cheese pie each! Nice guy running the show and was delicious, crunchy base and cheesy top. both of us satisfied with a drink for $10 dollars right off south beach. Would recommend!

Toni's is one of our favorite sushi restaurants in the country!! Always make time to stop here and have there wonderful variety of sushi! Uni special was great. It's a must for us.

Nothing to rave about this restaurant. It is an average sushi place, for the price paid, i could eat on other sushi bar for a lot less money. Service was slow, really it was just an standard average sushi restaurant.

Love this place. The sushi is good, but they also have a variety of Thai food. All quite good. It's kind of an institution on Key Biscayne. Their fried rice is great and plentiful. Good for families, take out, anytime. Good dragon rolls.

If you're looking for a good Japanese dish, you'll find a good one here but not authentic Japanese, but if you're looking for a great Thai dish, this is the place. We had some Tom Khar and Pad See Ew and both were excellent.

You have to try de Dragon Roll and ask for a roll with tuna and mango which is no longer on the menu, but they will do it for you! The salmon sashimi is great too! They have a lot of variety.

Finding "quiet" casual dining in South Florida can be difficult. More restaurants should follow Sushi Siam's approach...nice atmosphere...nice food and a restaurant where adults can carry a conversation over dinner.
Most South Florida establishments bombard you with tile floors...terrible acoustics and loud background music....What is the purpose????
Susi Siam serves a variety of Seafood...and as the name implies "Siam" you...


More  



Nothing to brag about but the basic food that you can find anywhere on the beach. The service can be erratic and the food is fine but not as authentic as you may believe.

So not go here - these people know nothing about customer service and how customers are supposed to be treated. They give bad service and then add an automatic 17% tip onto the bill...that's not how it's done in the USA! Food very average; prices high.

We did a trip all around America and the Bahamas and Sushi Siam was the best food we ate our whole trip (and our whole life!) we stayed in Miami 3 nights and went to Sushi Siam 4 times!! We have dreamt of this food since we left. Everything about the place was amazing. And the Gyoza is to die...


More  



On Lincoln Road they live off of non-return tourists, so the food is generally poor and expensive. This place is neither. We ate at this place two days in a row simply because they had one of the best sushis I have ever tried. I would definitely recommend the ''Sushi for two'' or ''Sushi Double'' because of the freshness and the very good taste, and for the serving plate itself which is a quite large wooden boat, aesthetically cool!

While staying at the Eden Roc we found this place for pizza. We had it delivered one night and went back for take-out another night, it was that good!

We got delivery service from this place. The sub and pizza were decent. The sub was stuffed almost overflowing with veggies making it a good late night meal.

Stayed at riu Miami beach. Pizza dude delivered there. Fast delivery. $13 for a 14inch pie with sausage. +$3 delivery and tax and tip $22. Pizza was OK. Not like new jersey or NY like I'm used to. I would probably order again if late night and so t wanna leave hotel.

Came here for lunch, had lunch special- pizza, soda and salad, cheap and food was good... Quick service I would come back again

My hubby walked over from the Fountainebleau and got a take out order for lunch. Pizza, a panini-which is more like a sub, and a chef salad. Pizza was good. Sub was meh and the chef salad was wonderful! Prices decent..for Miami Beach. Service was fast and friendly. Would stop again.

We ordered delivery from here and it was very good! Cooked well and thin and arrived on time! Delicious!

When entering the place was empty. However 15 minutes after that it was completely full. All the food is prepared on the spot when ordered. Even the tortilla chips and guacamole. Everything we had was tasty and portions were quite big. Service was sometimes a but slow though. Still would really recommend this place.

Got caught in rain storm outside of this restaurant. Had wanted to try it, so stepped in. Staff immediately came over to seat us, but said OK if we just wanted to ride out the rain. Decided to be seated, and had a very authentic Mexican lunch with great service at an affordable price.

Extremely polite staff, a simple place but very clean. The 3 of us enjoyed very much our different dishes, fresh, tasty.

Ordered delivery and after 2 hours when called, we realized mistake on delivery address.... Got yelled on the phone, not by one but two people!!! (Including the owner) Really? Instead of looking for a solution, we get this treatment after being clients for many years? DO NOT recommend it at all!!!

The mexican food we got in this restaurant was delicious and for a very reasonable price. But the attention of the waitress was simply awesome.Thanks!!!
I would definetely go for lunch there again

This was our second and final visit. There was nothing good about this restaurant. The food was bad it had no taste and the taco shells were stale. The service was bad and the waiter had an attitude. It took a long time to get served for mediocre overpriced food. Never again.

This is our 2nd try here. 1st time it was OK-nothing great but we figured we would try it again to be fair. This time, very mediocre.

title: Trouville Pizza y Restaurante, Miami Beach
address: Av. Collins y 71 St, Miami Beach, FL 33140

review_list:
Food is great. Real Chevitos from Uruguay in North Beach. Great, familiar service too. Some good Tanat would have been great to pair with the meal.

The food was good. Although it wasn't busy at the time we were there, the food took awhile and then the meat was overdone. Other than that, good service and great taste.

very warm welcome, the food is excellent, I do recommend it, the pizza by meter and the beef meat are excellent!!!!

Try the Chivito, an authentic Uruguayan sandwich and the Milanesa, crispy fried breaded beef.
For dessert the dulce de leche crepes are great!

I definitely recommend it. I had their Canadian chivito and it was incredible. It fills you up easily and it has such a nice environment even if it's a small place.

Very nice place and tasty food. First place where I seen pizza by meters:) you can take 1/2 m or whole meter of tasty pizza. Looks fabulous, will try next time. This time was for meat. Perfect skirt steak, nice wine. Kids meals are great as well. But ours especially liked freshly baked buns:)

We ate here twice while in Miami. Once it was excellent; great food. the second time it was mediocre. It did not have bread, the service was inattentive and food had declined. It made us reconsider how great it was on the first visit.

that experience was very good. the service was excellent, the people was friendly and the meal was exactly amazing. Chivitoteca is the best restaurant I've ever visited in miami beach. I love it so much and i will come back shore.

I had heard a lot about it, but even better than I had hoped for. I will be a regular here. Great unique food served promptly with good service at reasonable prices. The heck with Las Vacas Tontas . . . this will be my new place in town for great unique Uruguayan meats--anxious to try other offerings!

The chivitos were authentic and delicious - of a comparable size to what you would get in Uruguay. The atmosphere is laid back, service was a bit slow but staff were friendly. I would definitely return on future visits to Miami!
title: Chivitoteca, Miami Beach
